p: Levels of malondialdehyde (MDA) in backfat measured immediately after thawing (day 0) and after storage for three and five days in a refrigerator at 5 Â°C are shown in Table 6. A statistically significant effect of oil feeding duration was recorded for backfat stored for three and five days ( p < 0.001). The highest oxidative stability of lipids was ascertained in the backfat of pigs fed both oils for six weeks prior to slaughter.
